snippet.title: Women's teams play off for celebratory silverware
snippet.content: AUSSIE RULES: Although Maroochydore's finals hopes are dashed in the state's premier women's competition, there's still plenty to play for. The Roos will hit the field on Saturday (11am) against the UQ Lions in the final game of the season. To tie in with the 50th anniversary of the naming of the Sunshine Coast, the teams will be competing for much more than a win, rather a piece of celebratory silverware. The sides will contest for the inaugural 50th Anniversary Women's Cup at Maroochydore Multi-Sports Complex. Maroochydore coach Stuart Jackson hoped to finish the side's debut year in the Queensland Women's AFL with a victory. "We've been looking for an extra win and we've only beaten Zillmere so far this year," he said. "This is our last chance and the girls are pumped and ready." He said playing for the cup was a great way to cap-off what had been a tough season. "It's a significant event for the Sunshine Coast and the football club has jumped on board and managed to tie it in with the white ribbon foundation too," he said. It's the first year the Roos women have competed in the QWAFL, and they are placed sixth on the seven-team ladder. "We've got a very young team at the moment...we have the youngest team by a couple years on average," he said. "But we've got a lot of young talented players that have been through state programs and they should come good in a couple years time when they get a few games under their belt." The sport's popularity has boomed on the back of the national competition, according to Jackson, with the club able to field a side in the division two competition too. "The numbers are growing every year and we've doubled in numbers since last year so we're able to put two teams in," he said. "A lot of the clubs are now putting in for a licence to host women's teams and junior girls teams so there are a lot more opportunities." Maroochydore's men will host University of Queensland at the same venue (2pm) while Caloundra plays Coorparoo and Noosa hosts Burleigh.
